title: Khushu in Salah
introduction: Khushu means praying with deep humility, focus, and presence of heart. It is the essence of a meaningful salah, turning prayer from a routine act into a living connection with Allah. Khushu fills the heart with awe, peace, and love for the One we stand before.

sections.heading: What is Khushu?
sections.content: Khushu is the state of being fully aware and humbled while standing in prayer. Allah praises the believers: *'Certainly will the believers have succeeded: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive [with khushu].'* (Quran 23:1-2). It means to pray as if you see Allah, and if you cannot see Him, know that He sees you. It includes stillness of the body, calmness of the mind, and sincerity of the heart.

sections.heading: How to Develop Khushu
sections.content:
• Understand what you recite — learn the meanings of Surah Al-Fatihah and other parts of salah to engage your heart.  
• Pray unrushed and avoid distractions — find a quiet place, silence your phone, and leave worries outside the prayer mat.  
• Remind yourself that you are standing before your Lord — imagine this is your final prayer.  
• Perform wudu mindfully and approach prayer with calmness and intention.  
• Make dua asking Allah to grant you khushu — because it is a gift only He can give.

sections.heading: Benefits of Khushu
sections.content: Khushu brings inner peace and calmness that stays with you after prayer. It increases the reward of your salah and makes it more likely to protect you from sin: *'Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing…'* (Quran 29:45). It strengthens your connection with Allah, softens your heart, and fills it with gratitude and hope. A single prayer with deep khushu can be more valuable than many prayers performed distractedly.

conclusion: Strive for khushu in every salah, even if it is only for a few moments at first. With practice and sincere effort, you will taste the sweetness of true connection with Allah. May He grant us humble hearts and prayers filled with presence and love.
